acknowledgments.summary: Eran Jacob from OTORIO reported these vulnerabilities to Siemens.

notes.text: This CSAF advisory was extracted from unstructured data and may contain inaccuracies. If you notice any errors, please reach out to the designated contact at CISA CSAF: central@cisa.dhs.gov
notes.title: CISA Disclaimer

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow an attacker to modify and rename license files, extract licenses, and overwrite arbitrary files on the target system, potentially leading to privilege escalation and remote code execution.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of this vulnerability these vulnerabilities. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage at cisa.gov/ics. Several CISA products detailing cyber defense best practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage at cisa.gov/ics in the technical information paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: For further inquiries on security vulnerabilities in Siemens products and solutions, please contact the Siemens ProductCERT: https://www.siemens.com/cert/advisories
notes.title: Additional Resources

notes.text: No known public exploits specifically target these vulnerabilities.
notes.title: Exploitability

references.summary: SSA-476715: Two Vulnerabilities in Automation License Manager - CSAF Version
SSA-476715: Two Vulnerabilities in Automation License Manager - PDF Version
SSA-476715: Two Vulnerabilities in Automation License Manager - TXT Version

cwe.name: External Control of File Name or Path

notes.text:
The affected components allow to rename license files with user chosen input without authentication.
This could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to rename and move files as SYSTEM user.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: If no remote connections are needed, disable “Allow Remote Connections” on the Automation License Manager settings menu  (default since version V6.0 SP2)
Update to V6.0 SP9 Upd4 or later version
If remote connections are needed, limit remote access to port 4410/tcp to trusted systems only

As a general security measure, Siemens strongly recommends to protect network access to devices with appropriate mechanisms. In order to operate the devices in a protected IT environment, Siemens recommends to configure the environment according to Siemens' operational guidelines for Industrial Security (Download: 
https://www.siemens.com/cert/operational-guidelines-industrial-security), and to follow the recommendations in the product manuals.
Additional information on Industrial Security by Siemens can be found at: https://www.siemens.com/industrialsecurity

cwe.name: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')

notes.text:
The affected component does not correctly validate the root path on folder related operations, allowing to modify files and folders outside the intended root directory.
This could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to execute file operations of files outside of the specified root folder. Chained with CVE-2022-43513 this could allow Remote Code Execution.
notes.title: Summary

As a general security measure, Siemens strongly recommends to protect network access to devices with appropriate mechanisms.
